page.title: 16Denaby Market
page.content: The{derelict}air of the market with its dirty paperbags,air{polluted}with vile smells like fish,cigarette smoke and paint. A rush of voices greets us. The man on the jewellery stall giving no{encouragement,}just watching the world go by. Scuffed shoes look like five hundred hand giving an odour like rotten fish.An old couple searching in a jumble of old clothes. People seeking bargains. A junk of old cheap nasty dresses twenty years out of date in{tasteless depresssing}colours.An old rag doll sits alone,nobody giving it a second glance.Tommy Collins' Irish voice shouting his prices, the soil on his potatoes giving a fresh clean aroma.Juicy fresh rosy apples sitting on the stall inviting us to buy.Wrinkled oranges,unappetising.Yet in the market I always smell the flowers.Unemployment rules O.K. 30%.
